left.name: Rehabilitative
left.description: Believes the solution to crime is shared societal responsibility to create conditions where people will want to do the right thing instead of committing crime.

right.name: Punitive
right.description: Believes the solution to crime is harsher punishments so that potential criminals would be too afraid of the consequences to commit crime.

left.name: Shadow
left.description: Would rather the government conceal a lot of information pertaining to its operations

right.name: Transparent
right.description: Those with higher Resentful scores may rather stay angry for what has been done in the past, or believe that the wrongs one has done must be retributed for as soon as possible. As such, in politics they may prefer a punitive or retributive penal system. They may feel that being forgiving is not as virtuous as people make it out to be and base their morals on atonement for actions and equal cause and effect.

left.name: Honest
left.description: Those with higher Honest scores might feel less of a need to tell lies, they feel that it's important to tell the truth no matter the consequences, and do the right thing even when no one is looking, to have integrity.

right.name: Deceitful
right.description: Those with higher Deceitful scores might see to it that concealing or misleading people is more beneficial and a worthy sacrifice, perhaps even a pleasure, to achieve their goals. But some may not be able to help it, and are habitually lying to people to maintain a sense of security to escape from the consequences of their wrongs.

left.name: Religious
left.description: Believes in supernatural entities/happenings, focuses on the spiritual and thinks more about afterlife.

right.name: Atheist
right.description: Believes in material or ideational causes for all that happens, focuses on the here-and-now.

left.name: Dictated
left.description: Believes that mechanisms should ensure that everyone adheres to a particular belief system.

right.name: Secular
right.description: Believes people should be free to believe what they want.

left.name: Altruistic
left.description: Those with higher Altruistic scores try to do things physically for others, using what they have in terms of resources and ability to help out instead of keeping it to themselves.

right.name: Uncaring
right.description: Those with higher Uncaring scores may not want to lend others help in terms of their material possessions or through their better well-being allow some to benefit from it. They may rather keep what they own and believe themselves to be independent, wanting to work for themselves, not others.

left.name: Friendly
left.description: Those with higher Friendly scores place a high emphasis on deep interacts that touch people emotionally. They are often willing to give advice or talk in times of trouble and are consistently there for others

right.name: Cold
right.description: Those with higher Cold scores may feel that they don't need to be very close with friends, they might dislike making things too personal and in some cases might not maintain a good number of strong/close friendships.

left.name: Assertive
left.description: Those with higher Assertive scores have more self-esteem or value themselves highly. And may be unaffected by insults or they may act haughtily and are vocal in expression or attainment of their own needs/wants.

right.name: Turbulent
right.description: Those with higher Turbulent scores have lower self-esteem or do not value themselves very high. They may be more susceptible to degradation by others, or may be unwilling to stand up for themselves in what they want and might uneasily go along with others.

left.name: Optimist
left.description: Those with higher Optimist scores tend to have hope that things will get better in the future, and have a positive outlook on life, assuming that the natural state is good, good always overcomes evil, and might believe that human nature is inherently good or can easily be turned good in certain conditions.

right.name: Pessimist
right.description: Those with higher Pessimist scores tend to belive that things will not get better, or will get worse. And sometimes views the natural state as bad, and might believe that human nature is inherently evil. They may feel uneasy thinking about the future.
